![](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/11062b_4793fe0af291461a8cba127c8892477cf000.jpg/v1/fill/w_697,h_342,al_c,q_80,usm_0.33_1.00_0.00,enc_avif,quality_auto/11062b_4793fe0af291461a8cba127c8892477cf000.jpg)

The La Joya PUD acquired some of its facilities from the former La Joya Water Supply Corporation (WSC), predecessor to the
[Agua Special Utility District (SUD)](https://aguasud.com/)
.

[News](https://www.lajoyatx.gov/news)

![Glasses of Water](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/0509f257392744129433294f43c1310c.jpg/v1/crop/x_183,y_0,w_1682,h_1536/fill/w_372,h_339,al_c,q_80,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,enc_avif,quality_auto/Glasses%20of%20Water.jpg)

The Hidalgo County Irrigation District #16 supplies La Joya raw water via La Joya Lake.  The PUD operates a Water Treatment Plant (WTP) with a capacity of 0.8 million gallons per day (MGD).

![La Joya PUD wastewater lagoon](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/2f2ad4_5ae6412ad7d5469bb1c475fb570b7c9c~mv2.jpg/v1/crop/x_57,y_0,w_526,h_480/fill/w_372,h_339,al_c,q_80,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,enc_avif,quality_auto/IMG_0963.jpg)

The City collects and treats wastewater as permitted by the
[Texas Commission on Environmental Quality (TCEQ)](https://www.tceq.texas.gov/)
.  The Wastewater Treatment Plant (WWTP) located south of Military Road  may discharge 0.3 MGD into the Rio Grande River.

![Solid waste collections map](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/2f2ad4_788040e7601247f58d7d8f79c02070ad~mv2.png/v1/crop/x_56,y_0,w_406,h_371/fill/w_372,h_339,al_c,q_85,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,enc_avif,quality_auto/Collections%20Map.png)
